newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan stocks seen weak on Bhutto brother death.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan stocks seen weak on Bhutto brother death.

text.p: Pakistani stocks are likely to open weak on Sunday on political uncertainty prompted by the killing of Murtaza Bhutto, brother of Prime Minister Benazir Bhutto, dealers said.
Murtaza, 42, died after a shootout between his supporters and police in Karachi on Friday night.
The KSE 100-share index on Thursday surged 60.07 points, or 4.36 percent, to end at 1,438.42. There were 201 gainers and 71 losers.
Turnover rose to 49 million shares from 31 million in the previous session. -- Ovais Subhani 9221-5685192
